titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Broughton Papers, 1965-1977 AIS.1977.42
titlestmt.author: Stacey Webberon. Revisions occurred to the finding aid as a part of the encoding process on June 22, 2001.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:15:06 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The collection of Robert Broughton, a Duquesne University Law Professor active in environmental conservation and air pollution control issues in Allegheny County, contains correspondence, research, reports, and publications concerning local government and environmental law.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Robert Broughton, a Duquesne University Law Professor, actively participated in environmental conservation and air pollution control issues in Allegheny County. He joined Duquesne University in 1966 and became a full professor three years later. Broughton chaired the Allegheny County Board of Air Pollution Appeals and Variance Review, April 1970 - February 1973. He also served as chair of the Land Use Policy Committee of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Broughton's father, Philip S. Broughton, some of whose papers appear in this collection, served as a former vice chairman of the Allegheny County Board of Health.

Robert Broughton died on August 1, 1977, at the age of 42, while climbing Nanga Parbat, a mountain in Pakistan. An experienced climber, he participated in the climb along with others from the Pittsburgh Explorers' Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The papers of Robert Broughton consist of records dating from 1965 - 1977, and have been organized into 8 series: Subject Files, Citizen's Advisory Council to the Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Resources, Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Resources Environmental Quality Board, Correspondence, Manuscript Notes , Unpublished research papers and reports, Local Environmental Organizations and Environmental Law, and Publications. More information about the records is available at the individual series level. The Broughton Papers mainly concentrate on environmental issues affecting Pittsburgh and Allegheny County. Publications of mainly local and regional nature have been retained in the collection.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Suzanne Broughton, wife of Robert Broughton, 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Broughton Papers, 1965-1977, AIS.1977.42, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Archives Service Center Staff in 1998.

Revision and rearrangement for the encoded version of the finding aid provided by Kate Colligan in 2001. Information about the collection title and the controlled access terms was extracted from the MARC record in the University of Pittsburgh catalog Voyager ID number: 1415558

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

controlaccess.corpname: Allegheny County (Pa.). Bureau of Air Pollution Control

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence of the Allegheny County Bureau of Air Pollution Control retarding legal action against such Pittsburgh businesses as Duquesne Light (with emphasis on the Davis Power Project), Fort Pitt Steel Casting, and Jones Laughlin Steel Corporation. Other correspondence includes the Bureau's response to a state proposal to develop Rt. 801 at Sinnemahoning Creek, miscellaneous correspondence, and press releases.

did.unittitle: Blaw Knox Foundry Mill Machinery, Inc.
Allegheny County Bureau of Air Pollution Control
Citizen's Advisory Council to the Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Resources, 1969 - 1977

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contains minutes, correspondence and memos, various reports and testimonies, including annual reports, 1971-1972 and 1973-1974, and Office of State Planning and Development publications on land policy, adjudications of the Environmental Hearing Board, newsclippings, and miscellanea.

did.unittitle: Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Resources Environmental Quality Board, 1972

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contains regulations, agenda and minutes, fact sheets, and statements made to the Environmental Quality Board by the League of Women Voters.

did.unittitle: Adjucations of the Environmental Hearing Board
Citizen's Advisory Council to the Department of Environmental Resources--Miscellaneous

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contains personal correspondence with the National Forestry Service about the Monongahela National Forest, and several letters from U.S. Congressmen and Senators including Rep. Robert J. Corbett, Rep. H. John Heinz, III, Rep. John P. Saylor, and Sen. Hugh Scott.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes a folder of Broughton's personal writings and handwritten notes on a variety of topics. Also included are drafts of papers by Broughton and drafts and proposals written by his father, Philip S. Broughton..

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Copies of research papers given at various conferences.

did.unittitle: Local Environmental Organizations and Environmental Law

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series VII contains local government reports, along with the rules and regulations for air pollution emissions in Allegheny County, and the by-laws of many local environmental organizations. This series also contains transcripts and other court documents from various environmentally related cases. The court documents include reports of hearings of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania House of Representative's Special Committee on Pesticide Control from 1970, and transcripts of cases involving groups or organizations such as the Pennsylvania Environmental Council, National Helium Corporation, Environmental Defense Fund, Department of Housing and Urban Development, United States Steel Corporation, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, County of Allegheny,the United States of America, Natural Resources Defense Council, Natural Lands Trust, the Texas Committee on Natural Resources, Manufacturers Light and Heat Company, Raccoon Valley Conservation Association, and several local labor unions. Copies of rules and regulations of the Allegheny County Health Department regarding air pollution and the Air Management and Air Pollution Control Regulations and Amendments can also be found in this series.
